title: Amjad Ali Noon
text:
Malik Amjad Ali Noon, born on 17 June 1954 in <a href="Lahore">Lahore</a>, <a href="Punjab%2C%20Pakistan">Punjab, Pakistan</a> is a <a href="Pakistani">Pakistani</a> <a href="politician">politician</a>.
Family.
His father <a href="Malik%20Anwer%20Ali%20Noon">Malik Anwer Ali Noon</a> (1924 – 12 September 2014) mostly had lived in their hometown village <a href="Ali%20Pur%20Noon">Ali Pur Noon</a> during his lifetime. The Noon family has 27 villages in <a href="Bhalwal">Bhalwal</a> Tehsil: <a href="Nurpur%20Noon">Nurpur Noon</a>, <a href="Sultan%20Pur%20Noon">Sultan Pur Noon</a> and <a href="Sardar%20Pur%20Noon">Sardar Pur Noon</a>, among others. Malik <a href="Feroz%20Khan%20Noon">Feroz Khan Noon</a> ex-Prime Minister of Pakistan was also a prominent member of the Noon family.
Education.
Amjad Ali Noon got his early education from the prestigious <a href="Aitchison%20College">Aitchison College</a> and his bachelor's degree from the <a href="Forman%20Christian%20College">Forman Christian College</a>, <a href="Lahore">Lahore</a>. He has studied the Law and has attended in his capacity as a member of the District Government, the <a href="National%20Institute%20of%20Public%20Administration%20%28Pakistan%29">National Institute of Public Administration (Pakistan)</a> (NIPA), <a href="Lahore">Lahore</a>, and the <a href="National%20Defence%20University%2C%20Pakistan">National Defence University, Pakistan</a> in <a href="Islamabad">Islamabad</a>.
Political career.
At the age of 34, Noon was the youngest <a href="High%20Commissioner">High Commissioner</a> of Pakistan to <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>. He was also <a href="Ambassador">Ambassador</a> Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Pakistan to <a href="Rwanda">Rwanda</a>, <a href="Ethiopia">Ethiopia</a> and <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a> under the <a href="Pakistan%20Peoples%20Party">Pakistan Peoples Party</a> (PPP) government of <a href="Benazir%20Bhutto">Benazir Bhutto</a> (1989–90).
Amjad Ali Noon served as the Zila <a href="Nazim">Nazim</a> <a href="Sargodha">Sargodha</a> (District Governor) in 2002. At the launching ceremony of the Sargodha Transport Network, he stated that the district government had fulfilled a promise of providing cheap transport facility to the public.
His political affiliations have been with the <a href="Pakistan%20Peoples%20Party">Pakistan Peoples Party</a>. In 2010, he also served as Chairman of the "Prime Minister's Inspection Commission of Pakistan".
In 2011 and 2012, Amjad Ali Noon was serving as President, Punjab Squash Association, a sports organisation.
